Our group has demonstrated that oral administration of linoleic acid (LA, 18:2ω-6) at a dose of 0.22 g/kg bw for 10 days promoted wound healing in rats, because it improved the inflammatory response and angiogenesis
8, 11, 12 . The effects of omega-3 (ω-3) fatty acids on wound healing are less clear
6 .
